ygData.subject: Re: Heritrix "hangs" and doesn't finish its job

Hi everyone,

I'v dug some more through the Heritrix sources to track down =
the
problem but haven't found a solution yet. This problem starts to get
re=
ally annoying as it happens on almost every big crawl I'm running
(500+ see=
ds) but rarly on small ones with less seeds.

I haven't found a cause yet b=
ut have some theories what might cause it
(even though I might be totally w=
rong).

The most propable theory so far is the following:
Two ToeThreads wo=
rking on different URIs from different queues come
accross the same (so far=
 unseen) URI at more or less "the exact same
moment". Both threads come to =
the conclusion that their URI is new and
try to enqueue it in the currect q=
ueue. While doing this both of them
increment to queuedUriCount by 1 but th=
e queue itself being smart
enough only contains one of them.

I'll increase=
 logging to see if my theory might be true and report
back later.


If anyo=
ne has any other idea in the meantime I'll be happy to hear
about it.

Than=
ks alot
  Olaf Freyer


--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "pandae667"=
 <aaron667@...> wrote:
>
> Hi everyone here at archive-crawler,
> 
> I'm ex=
periencing a strange problem with my crawler (heritrix cvs +
> AddRedirectF=
romRootServerToScope fix from Gordon). It happened to me
> twice so far.
> =

> After about 1 hour it has fetched (allmost?) all the documents it is
> s=
upposed to (about 9000 seeds and a limit of 100 documents per host)
> and t=
hen just "hangs".
> 
> The Frontier Report tells me:
> 
>  -----=3D=3D=3D=
=3D=3D STATS =3D=3D=3D=3D=3D-----
>  Discovered:    1008968
>  Queued:     =
   24

>   Successfully: 426289
>   Failed:       1=
565
>   Disregarded:  4570
> 
>  -----=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D QUEUES =3D=3D=3D=3D=
=3D-----
>  Already included size:     1008968
>                pending:   =
  0
> 
>  All class queues map size: 12872
>              Active queues: 0
=
>                     In-process: 0
>                          Ready: 0
>  =
                      Snoozed: 0
>            Inactive queues: 0
>         =
    Retired queues: 2226
>           Exhausted queues: 10646
> 
>  -----=3D=
=3D=3D=3D=3D IN-PROCESS QUEUES =3D=3D=3D=3D=3D-----
> 
> So there are still=
 24 queued URIs - but no active queue left (last
> time a queue did anythin=
g was about 12 hours ago).
> 
> Thanks in advance for any ideas
>   Olaf Fr=
eyer
